alert.note: Alert for Barry (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 10 at 5:32PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occuring. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following county, Barry. * WHEN...Until 845 AM CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 530 PM CST, gauge reports indicated heavy rain from early this morning has caused flooding in the Flat Creek basin. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. - This includes the following low water crossings... Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145, Flat Creek at Highway Y, Flat Creek at Highway C and Flat Creek at Highway U. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cassville, Purdy, Exeter, Washburn, Butterfield, Mcdowell, Jenkins, Pleasant Ridge, Madry and Wayne. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
